comment.body:
Hi, can't see the video for some reason.... but if it's the one that has been reshared around diaspora* for a while, then I agree: it's pretty fucking awesome.

Keep P2P strong! Keep using and promoting it!

Yessir, P2P everywhere indeed! :)

Perhaps it's a bug on ZeroNet itself? There was a talk a while ago in [0chan](http://127.0.0.1:43110/dev.0chan.bit) about some image files - namely GIFs - not working properly either. Maybe it's a MIME issue or something.

Awesome! I will definitely be trying some of these out and adding them to the [Project Swarm](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GiJUPsfiS3LWCyZj5urW1Rt2q9WwRh4wB/?Post:10:Project+Swarm:+digital+life+based+on+P2P)'s roster.

GitTorrent seems to have a lot of potential!

Yes! **MeshNets** do need *a lot* of our attention as well.

Whereas P2P is a lot concerned about enabling *services*, these still need to run over some kind of *network*, which almost all of the time is a proprietary-owned ISP internet connection. Meshnets could come in to solve this problem: with enough of them, we would literally have P2P internet connection.

Keep P2P strong!

Great site indeed! Thanks for the updates, sbee.

I wish I could subscribe to it, so that these updates would appear in my feed as well.

Keep up the good work!
